Body: My Location History often shows a point far away from where I was. It does not seem to be a problem with determining my location (GPS or whatever method). Last Friday it suddenly showed a single point about 200km away from where I was, and guess what? The point was exactly where I have a cottage on the coast. i.e.: I have been there often, but certainly not on Friday.What is the cause of this, and can I fix it, or is it something for Google ?I have read Google Maps Location History is showing an incorrect location and I don't think it's a duplicate of that question. Firstly, this is showing a point where I have been before very often (a house of mine 200km away where I have last been in December) not just a random faulty point. The answers to the previous question speculated about GPS accuracy and this is clearly not the same issue.
Title: Occasional incorrect point on Location History; the point is the place I often visit

history.Text: My Location History often shows a point far away from where I was. It does not seem to be a problem with determining my location (GPS or whatever method).Last Friday it suddenly showed a single point about 200 kM away from where I was, and guess what? The point was exactly where I have a cottage on the coast. i.e.: I have been there often, but certainly not on Friday.What is the cause of this, and can I fix it, or is it something for Google ?
Occational Incorrect point on Location History

My Location History often shows a point far away from where I was. It does not seem to be a problem with determining my location (GPS or whatever method).Last Friday it suddenly showed a single point about 200 kM away from where I was, and guess what? The point was exactly where I have a cottage on the coast. i.e.: I have been there often, but certainly not on Friday.What is the cause of this, and can I fix it, or is it something for Google ?Matthew Read, The question is not the same as: Google Maps Location History is showing an incorrect location. I read that before posting. Firstly this is showing a point where I have been before very often (a house of mine 200 km away where I have last been in December) not just a random faulty point. The answers to the previous question speculated about GPS accuracy and this is clearly not the same issue. You should investigate in more detail before simply marking something as duplicate.

history.Comment: avoid name calling, resolve the duplicate in neutral way
